      When disabled (false), may cause the game to enter a non-standard (implemented by the bot) low graphics mode.
      void setSkipLines(boolean flag)
      Some implementations support a low graphics mode that skips lines when rendering (usually toggled by pressing F1).

      Enables or disables fatigue tricking, which is disabled by default.
      void setTypeLine(java.lang.String str)
      Sets the line to be typed by next().
      static void sleep(int ms)
      Deprecated. 
      Will cause the entire game to freeze when called in main()'s thread. The RSC servers expect a ping every 5 seconds among other things, so use of this method is definitely not recommended. If you find yourself using this, consider updating your code to make use of System.currentTimeMillis() or System.nanoTime().
      void stopScript()
      Stops the script.

      • main

        public int main()
        The bot will wait for the milliseconds main() returns before calling it again. It is only called when logged in and not sleeping. Override it and use it for your Script's logic processing.
        Specified by:
        main in interface com.aposbot._default.IScript

      • onKeyPress

        public void onKeyPress(int keycode)
        Called when the user presses a key on the keyboard and the client is the active window. Do not use this to send key events, it does not work that way. Instead use void setTypeLine(String s) and boolean next().
        Specified by:
        onKeyPress in interface com.aposbot._default.IScript
        Parameters:
        keycode - the key pressed expressed as an integer
        See Also:

      • disableKeys

        public void disableKeys()
        Disables keys used by the bot so they can be used by the script. They are enabled again when the user stops the script.

      • setTrickMode

        public void setTrickMode(boolean flag)
        Enables or disables fatigue tricking, which is disabled by default. If the player kills certain NPCs with 99% fatigue in melee combat, they can gain combat XP without hitpoints XP. If the bot is instructed to use the fatigue trick, it will attempt to keep the fatigue at 99% when it sleeps. The script should take care of the rest.
        Parameters:
        flag - on/off

      • getAllNpcById

        public int[] getAllNpcById(int... ids)
        Locates the nearest NPC with the given id(s). This will search all NPCs in the area regardless of whether they are in combat or talking.
        Parameters:
        ids - the NPC id(s) to search for.
        Returns:
        always an integer array of size 3. If no NPC can be found, the array will contain -1, -1, -1. If an NPC was found, the array will contain the NPC's local index, X, Y.
        See Also:
        getNpcById(int...), getNpcByIdNotTalk(int...), getNpcInExtendedRadius(int, int, int, int, int), getNpcInRadius(int, int, int, int)

      • getNpcById

        public int[] getNpcById(int... ids)
        Locates the nearest NPC with the given id(s). This will skip NPCs which are in combat.
        Parameters:
        ids - the NPC id(s) to search for.
        Returns:
        always an integer array of size 3. If no NPC can be found, the array will contain -1, -1, -1. If an NPC was found, the array will contain the NPC's local index, X, Y.
        See Also:
        getAllNpcById(int...), getNpcByIdNotTalk(int...), getNpcInExtendedRadius(int, int, int, int, int), getNpcInRadius(int, int, int, int)

      • getNpcByIdNotTalk

        public int[] getNpcByIdNotTalk(int... ids)
        Locates the nearest NPC with the given id(s). This will skip NPCs which are talking.
        Parameters:
        ids - the NPC id(s) to search for.
        Returns:
        always an integer array of size 3. If no NPC can be found, the array will contain -1, -1, -1. If an NPC was found, the array will contain the NPC's local index, X, Y.
        See Also:
        getAllNpcById(int...), getNpcById(int...), getNpcInExtendedRadius(int, int, int, int, int), getNpcInRadius(int, int, int, int)

      • getNpcInRadius

        public final int[] getNpcInRadius(int id,
                   int start_x,
                   int start_y,
                   int radius)
        Locates the nearest NPC with the given id within a radius. This is equivalent to a call to getNpcInExtendedRadius(id, start_x, start_y, radius, radius).
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the NPC to search for.
        start_x - the center X of the circle area.
        start_y - the center Y of the circle area.
        radius - the radius of the circle area.
        Returns:
        always an integer array of size 3. If no NPC can be found, the array will contain -1, -1, -1. If an NPC was found, the array will contain the NPC's local index, X, Y.
        See Also:
        getNpcInExtendedRadius(int, int, int, int, int), getAllNpcById(int...), getNpcById(int...), getNpcByIdNotTalk(int...)

      • getNpcInExtendedRadius

        public int[] getNpcInExtendedRadius(int id,
                           int start_x,
                           int start_y,
                           int latitude,
                           int longitude)
        Locates the nearest NPC with the given id(s) within a radius. This will skip NPCs which are in combat.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the NPC to search for.
        start_x - the center X of the circle area.
        start_y - the center Y of the circle area.
        latitude - the distance east & west of center X's area.
        longitude - the distance north & south of center Y's area.
        Returns:
        always an integer array of size 3. If no NPC can be found, the array will contain -1, -1, -1. If an NPC was found, the array will contain the NPC's local index, X, Y.
        See Also:
        getNpcInRadius(int, int, int, int), getAllNpcById(int...), getNpcById(int...), getNpcByIdNotTalk(int...)

      • setRendering

        public void setRendering(boolean flag)
        When disabled (false), may cause the game to enter a non-standard (implemented by the bot) low graphics mode. The graphics buffer may no longer be updated. When re-enabled, there may be a minor delay before the buffer is updated again.
        Parameters:
        flag - the rendering flag.

      • isRendering

        public boolean isRendering()
        See setRendering(boolean). This checks the set flag.
        Returns:
        true if rendering is enabled.

      • setSkipLines

        public void setSkipLines(boolean flag)
        Some implementations support a low graphics mode that skips lines when rendering (usually toggled by pressing F1). This enables or disables that mode.
        Parameters:
        flag - the skip_lines flag.

      • isSkipLines

        public boolean isSkipLines()
        See setSkipLines(boolean). This checks the set flag.
        Returns:
        true if skip_lines is enabled.

      • setPaintOverlay

        public void setPaintOverlay(boolean flag)
        If paint_overlay is disabled, paint() will not be called and the built-in bot display (if any) will be hidden. May be effected by the rendering flag setRendering(boolean).
        Parameters:
        flag - the paint_overlay flag.

      • isPaintOverlay

      • sleep

        @Deprecated
public static void sleep(int ms)
        Deprecated. Will cause the entire game to freeze when called in main()'s thread. The RSC servers expect a ping every 5 seconds among other things, so use of this method is definitely not recommended. If you find yourself using this, consider updating your code to make use of System.currentTimeMillis() or System.nanoTime().
        Parameters:
        ms - time in milliseconds to sleep for.
